SEARCH
Package org.controller

Class UserGameClient

java.lang.Object
org.controller.GameClient
org.controller.UserGameClient
public class UserGameClient extends GameClient
Represents a game client for a user player, extending the base GameClient class. This class handles user interactions and updates the game screen accordingly.

  • Method Details

    • placePiece

      public void placePiece()
      Whether the player can currently interact with the game (i.e., it's their turn). This is set to true when it's the player's turn and false otherwise.
      Overrides:
      placePiece in class GameClient

    • removePieceFromOpponent

      public void removePieceFromOpponent()
      Updates the game screen to reflect the current state of pieces left to place and pieces removed. This method is called whenever a piece is removed from the opponent.
      Overrides:
      removePieceFromOpponent in class GameClient

    • opponentPlaced

      public void opponentPlaced()
      Updates the game screen to reflect the current state of pieces left to place and pieces removed. This method is called whenever the opponent places a piece on the board.
      Overrides:
      opponentPlaced in class GameClient

    • removePieceFromMe

      public void removePieceFromMe()
      Updates the game screen to reflect the current state of pieces left to place and pieces removed. This method is called whenever a piece is removed from the player.
      Overrides:
      removePieceFromMe in class GameClient

    • initGameClient

      public void initGameClient(MapModel mapModel, PlayerColor playerColor, GameController gameController)
      Initializes the game client with the provided map model, player color, and game controller. This is not in the constructor, because these parameters are not known at instantiation time.
      Parameters:
      mapModel - the map model representing the game board
      playerColor - the color of the player
      gameController - the game controller managing the game logic

    • sendUp

      public void sendUp(int field)
      Sends a message up to the game controller indicating that the player has clicked on a field. If it is the player's turn (focus is true), the input is forwarded to the game controller.
      Specified by:
      sendUp in class GameClient
      Parameters:
      field - the index of the field that was clicked

    • sendDownNone

      public void sendDownNone()
      Sends a message down to the client indicating that it is not their turn. Updates the game screen to reflect that the player cannot interact with the game at this time. Resets all fields to their default state based on their colors.

    • sendDownColors

      public void sendDownColors(List<Integer> fields, List<BoardModel.Color> colors)
      Sends a message down to the client to update multiple fields with their respective colors. Updates the game screen to reflect the colors of the specified fields.
      Overrides:
      sendDownColors in class GameClient
      Parameters:
      fields - a list of field indices to be updated
      colors - a list of colors corresponding to the fields

    • sendDownColor

      public void sendDownColor(List<Integer> fields, BoardModel.Color color)
      Sends a message down to the client to update multiple fields with a specific color. Updates the game screen to reflect the specified color for the given fields.
      Overrides:
      sendDownColor in class GameClient
      Parameters:
      fields - a list of field indices to be updated
      color - the color to be applied to the specified fields

    • sendDownColor

      public void sendDownColor(Integer field, BoardModel.Color color)
      Sends a message down to the client to update a single field with a specific color. Updates the game screen to reflect the specified color for the given field.
      Overrides:
      sendDownColor in class GameClient
      Parameters:
      field - the index of the field to be updated
      color - the color to be applied to the specified field

    • sendDownPlace

      public void sendDownPlace(List<Integer> possibleFields)
      Sends a message down to the client indicating that it is their turn to place a piece. Updates the game screen to highlight possible fields where the player can place their piece. Changes the label text to prompt the player to place a piece.
      Parameters:
      possibleFields - a list of field indices where the player can place their piece

    • sendDownRemove

      public void sendDownRemove(@NotNull List<Integer> opponentFields)
      Sends a message down to the client indicating that it is their turn to remove an opponent's piece. Updates the game screen to highlight opponent fields that can be removed. Changes the label text to prompt the player to remove an opponent's piece.
      Parameters:
      opponentFields - a list of field indices where the player can remove an opponent's piece

    • sendDownMove

      public void sendDownMove(@NotNull List<Integer> movableFields)
      Sends a message down to the client indicating that it is their turn to move a piece. Updates the game screen to highlight pieces that can be moved. Changes the label text to prompt the player to move a piece.
      Parameters:
      movableFields - a list of field indices where the player can move their pieces from

    • sendDownMoveTo

      public void sendDownMoveTo(Integer fieldToMove, List<Integer> possibleFields)
      Sends a message down to the client indicating that it is their turn to move a specific piece to a new location. Updates the game screen to highlight the selected piece and possible destination fields. Changes the label text to prompt the player to select a destination for the move.
      Parameters:
      fieldToMove - the index of the field containing the piece to be moved
      possibleFields - a list of field indices where the player can move the selected piece to

    • exitGame

      public void exitGame()
      Exits the game and notifies the game controller. This method is called when the player chooses to exit the game.
      Overrides:
      exitGame in class GameClient

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Ends the game and updates the game screen accordingly. This method is called when the game concludes, either by a player winning or other end conditions.
